@1,2@ Returns the time of the last modification of {{c|p}}, determined as if by accessing the member {{tt|st_mtime}} of the POSIX [https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/stat.html {{tt|stat}}] (symlinks are followed).
The non-throwing overload returns {{c|file_time_type::min()}} on errors.
@3,4@ Changes the time of the last modification of {{c|p}}, as if by POSIX [https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/futimens.html {{tt|futimens}}] (symlinks are followed).

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|p|path to examine or modify}}
{{par|new_time|new modification time}}
{{par|ec|out-parameter for error reporting in the non-throwing overload}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
@1,2@ The time of the last modification of {{c|p}}.
@3,4@ (none)

===Exceptions===
{{cpp/filesystem/error_handling|p|throw=1,3/2,4}}

===Notes===
It is not guaranteed that immediately after setting the write time, the value returned by {{v|1,2}} is the same as what was passed as the argument to {{v|3,4}} because the file system's time may be more granular than {{lc|std::filesystem::file_time_type|filesystem::file_time_type}}.
